Dissertation Seminar.Description: A multidisciplinary seminar that focuses on the design, implementation, and evaluation of urban programs under real-life conditions in the field.  Students and faculty work with urban decision makers utilizing problem-solving skills and analysis.

TechnicalAndDigitalSkills: Proficiency in urban policy analysis tools
Understanding of urban program evaluation methodologies
Application of GIS for urban planning
Competence in data-driven decision-making
Knowledge of public finance in urban contexts
InterpersonalAndCommunicationSkills: Effective collaboration with urban decision makers
ProblemSolvingAndAnalyticalSkills: Analyzing complex urban administration problems
Developing innovative solutions for urban programs
Evaluating the impact of urban policies and projects
Critical thinking in public administration scenarios
Synthesizing interdisciplinary research insights
OrganizationalAndLeadershipSkills: Strategic planning in urban governance
Leadership in multidisciplinary research projects
Time management in dissertation and research activities
Organizing urban policy workshops and seminars
Supervising urban program design and implementation

Dissertation.Description: An approved research project, written under the supervision of a faculty advisor, in which the student demonstrates the capacity of design and completes independent applied research.  The completed project must be approved by the dissertation committee.
